alert.note: Alert for Archuleta (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 19 at 9:10AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 900 AM THURSDAY UNTIL 900 AM FRIDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...northern Archuleta and southern Mineral Counties, along with the entirety of Saguache, Rio Grande, Alamosa, Conejos, and Costilla Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Pagosa Springs, Saguache, Del Norte, Alamosa, Conejos, and San Luis. WHEN...900 AM Thursday May 19 to 900 AM Friday May 20 IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy smoke can be expected Thursday morning for areas in close vicinity to the Plumtaw wildfire, including Pagosa Springs. Air quality will improve by late Thursday morning as atmospheric mixing increases and smoke lifts into the atmosphere. However, periods of moderate to heavy smoke will be possible downwind to the east of the fire along the Archuleta and Mineral County line, and additional heavy smoke impacts will be possible across the San Luis Valley. By late Thursday evening smoke will begin to drain to locations south and southwest of the fire, including Pagosa Springs, bringing occasional heavy smoke through early Friday morning. Any smoke in the San Luis Valley could also linger through early Friday morning. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
